sagex.phoenix.weather

Interface IWeatherData

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    WeatherData

    public interface IWeatherData
    Interface to access the Weather Date for either the current weather conditions or for the forecasted weather. Not all fields will have data, depending on type of data being populated (ie, current or forecast)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getCode()
      Return the weather condition code, as described in http://developer.yahoo.com/weather/#codes

      java.lang.String getCodeText()
      Returns a textual description of the current weather code, ie, "snow showers"
      java.util.Date getDate()
      Returns the Date for the given weather condition
      java.lang.String getDay()
      Return the day for the forecasted weather, ie, "Mon", "Tue", "Wed", etc.
      java.lang.String getHigh()
      Returns the formatted High Temperature for the forecasted weather.
      java.lang.String getLow()
      Returns the formatted Low Temperature for the forecasted weather.
      java.lang.String getSunrise()
      Returns the Sunrise time, such as, "7:28 am", if known (Usually only set on current weather instance)
      java.lang.String getSunset()
      Returnt he Sunset time, such as, "4:53 pm", if known (Usually only set on current weather instance)
      java.lang.String getTemp()
      Returns the current formatted temperature.
      java.lang.String getText()
      Returns a descriptive text for the current weather condition.

    • Method Detail

      • getDate

        java.util.Date getDate()
        Returns the Date for the given weather condition
        Returns:
        Date

      • getLow

        java.lang.String getLow()
        Returns the formatted Low Temperature for the forecasted weather.

        java.lang.String getTemp()
        Returns the current formatted temperature.
        Returns:
        current temp

      • getText

        java.lang.String getText()
        Returns a descriptive text for the current weather condition. It will be something like, "Mostly Cloudy", or "Partly Sunny"
        Returns:
        textual description of the current weather condition.

      • getCode

        java.lang.String getCode()
        Return the weather condition code, as described in http://developer.yahoo.com/weather/#codes 

         0      tornado
 1      tropical storm
 2      hurricane
 3      severe thunderstorms
 4      thunderstorms
 5      mixed rain and snow
 6      mixed rain and sleet
 7      mixed snow and sleet
 8      freezing drizzle
 9      drizzle
 10     freezing rain
 11     showers
 12     showers
 13     snow flurries
 14     light snow showers
 15     blowing snow
 16     snow
 17     hail
 18     sleet
 19     dust
 20     foggy
 21     haze
 22     smoky
 23     blustery
 24     windy
 25     cold
 26     cloudy
 27     mostly cloudy (night)
 28     mostly cloudy (day)
 29     partly cloudy (night)
 30     partly cloudy (day)
 31     clear (night)
 32     sunny
 33     fair (night)
 34     fair (day)
 35     mixed rain and hail
 36     hot
 37     isolated thunderstorms
 38     scattered thunderstorms
 39     scattered thunderstorms
 40     scattered showers
 41     heavy snow
 42     scattered snow showers
 43     heavy snow
 44     partly cloudy
 45     thundershowers
 46     snow showers
 47     isolated thundershowers
 3200   not available

        Implementations should map their condition codes to the codes listed

        Returns:

      • getCodeText

        java.lang.String getCodeText()
        Returns a textual description of the current weather code, ie, "snow showers"
        Returns:
        textual description of the weather code

      • getDay

        java.lang.String getDay()
        Return the day for the forecasted weather, ie, "Mon", "Tue", "Wed", etc.
        Returns:
        day for the forecasted weather.

      • getSunrise

        java.lang.String getSunrise()
        Returns the Sunrise time, such as, "7:28 am", if known (Usually only set on current weather instance)
        Returns:
        time of sunrise

      • getSunset

        java.lang.String getSunset()
        Returnt he Sunset time, such as, "4:53 pm", if known (Usually only set on current weather instance)
        Returns:
        time of sunset
